causalFactors.description: Patient's age group derived from the Wolfram dataset

causeOutcome.reasoning: Older adults are likely to have higher mortality rates than younger adults

causeExposure.reasoning: Older adults are more likely to experience chronic diseases than younger adults

causalFactors.description: Patient gender recorded in the Wolfram dataset

causeOutcome.reasoning: There might be differences in risk of mortality between men and women

causeExposure.reasoning: Women tend to be more affected by long-term and chronic illness

exposure.label: Chronic Disease
exposure.description: Patient presented in the Wolfram dataset who reported having a chronic disease prior to contracting COVID-19

definition.description: A binary variable indicating whether the patient reported having a chronic disease
COVID-19 patients recorded in the Wolfram dataset. Records must include complete information on the patient's age, gender, chronic disease status, and survival status

population.label: Confirmed COVID-19 Cases
population.description: Patients who tested positive for COVID-19 and were presented in the Wolfram's Patient Medical Data for Novel Coronavirus COVID-19 dataset

definition.description: COVID-19 patients recorded in the Wolfram dataset. Records must include complete information on the patient's age, gender, chronic disease status, and survival status

outcome.label: Mortality Risk
outcome.description: Patients did not survive after contracting COVID-19

definition.description: Binary variable indicating whether the patient died after contracting COVID-19
